name: simpletime
info:
This lightweight sub-flow produces a Date/Time output in different formats for use in node-red flows.  
The sub-flow creates a `simpletime` node which can be inserted in any running flow, and adds the following messages to the flow; 

* msg.myrawdate: "2017-11-08T20:36:26.257Z"
* msg.myepoch: 1510173386257
* msg.mydate: "Wed Nov 08 2017"
* msg.myhour: "20"
* msg.myminute: "36"
* msg.myminutes: "36:26"
* msg.mysecond: "26"
* msg.mytime: "20:36"
* msg.mytimes: "20:36:26"

All other messages such as msg.payload & topic pass straight through the node unhindered.

To introduce any of the messages into a flow, simply assign any, or any combination of the messages into a variable(s), such as; `var seconds = msg.myseconds;`  
or to use in a ui_text node add via mustache `{{msg.mytimes}}` 

For advanced functionality, I would strongly recommend using the node-red-contrib-moment which is better equipped to handle edge-cases.

Any feedback - please give me a shout - @rossoreed on [node-red slack](https://nodered.org/slack)
